definitions: Past tense of blow, meaning to expel air from the mouth.
Past tense of blow, meaning to move or be carried by the wind.
Past tense of blow, meaning to explode or cause to explode.
Past tense of blow, meaning to spend money carelessly or wastefully.
Past tense of blow, meaning to ruin or bungle something.
examples: The bomb blew up the building.
She blew all her savings on a new car.
He blew his chance at promotion.
